data.title: Double Dragon - Original Monitor Type?
data.meta_description: I started working on a Taito Double Dragon game (in my pile of projects), and was wondering what monitor(s) was originally used in the game?  It currently...
data.text:
I started working on a Taito Double Dragon game (in my pile of projects), and was wondering what monitor(s) was originally used in the game? It currently has a Nintendo monitor in it, but it seems that someone in the past had previously tried to hack that into the cabinet. I see that they tried to just use the normal 120VAC power for the Nintendo, which is likely why the AC and DC fuses for the Nintendo monitor are missing from the chassis...

Thanks in advance for any thoughts!

Dave

I started working on a Taito Double Dragon game (in my pile of projects), and was wondering what monitor(s) was originally used in the game? It currently has a Nintendo monitor in it, but it seems that someone in the past had previously tried to hack that into the cabinet. I see that they tried to just use the normal 120VAC power for the Nintendo, which is likely why the AC and DC fuses for the Nintendo monitor are missing from the chassis...

Thanks in advance for any thoughts!

Dave

19" K7000 with a resistor in the Verticle height section cut off. Yes seriously... DD boards seem to start off really high/or low on the screen.

19" K7000 with a resistor in the Verticle height section cut off. Yes seriously... DD boards seem to start off really high/or low on the screen.

I think they are called slim mount. Dynamo hs-1s had them too for ez monitor rotation.
